Subdivision Lot: PT LOT 1 THE CROSSINGS AT HICKORY HOLLOW PH 2
Purpose: BUILDING C. Must comply with MASTER PERMIT #T2021052866. BUILDING A (SEE SITE PLAN ATTACHED) and SP. The Crossings project involves the design of 359 multi-family units over 8 total buildings with a small Clubhouse and pool amenity space. There are three types of multi-family buildings (R-2 Occupancy, Type VA Construction, fully sprinklered - NFPA 13R). “Building Type 1” is an “L” shaped four-story building with an elevator; “Building Type 2” is a three-story building with conditioned corridors (no elevator); and “Building Type 3” is a three-story building (no elevator) with conditioned corridors and “tuck-under” garages. “Building Type 1” has 5 Live work units at the ground floor that could be used for office/retail spaces combined with living space or just as typical apartments. The amenity/Clubhouse building will be constructed with Type VB Construction type and is not sprinklered. POC WHITNEY JOHNSON 615-850-5509 BB POC DUANE CUTHBERTSON

Covered Patio with Fireplace. The project consists of removing the existing porch cover, dig new footers and frame a (1) level deck with (2) rectangles. Replace old porch cover with a 28' x 12' shed style roof off the rear and another 16' x 12' shed style roof on the side. Run gas lines for the ventless gas fireplace and electrical for the lights and ceiling fans. Project costs are estimated at $68,375.00.
Extend the gable end of the home to the current position of the carport, enclose as additional home sqft.

Construction of one covered deck at the rear of the home atop an existing concrete paver patio, approx. 468 soft. A secondary deck that is tiered down from the first that will not be covered, approx. 261sqft. Both decks are below 30” in height due to the fall of the grade toward the garage apron, and will only have a drink rail top and the upper deck will be screened. There will be a fireplace at the northern edge of the cover with chimney that extends above the proposed gable cover, it will be no less than 10ft from home and will maintain roofing offset of 3 ft from highest pitch. There will be a natural gas igniter system installed.

Purpose: 11/07/22: project scope modified to create additional office space within the shell building. Revised building plans to be submitted via Bluebeam. DD-B. This project is a speculative warehouse shell building - building 100, Airport parcel 2 - The building is 127,034 square feet. There is a portion of office space built. the remainder of the space will be finished when a tenant has signed a lease to occupy the building. The floor design is concrete slab on grade. The exterior wall design is structural tilt up concrete walls. There is no EIFS, wood, metal, or vinyl siding on this project. The buidling sturcture is steel columns with steel joists and girders. The roof design is a structural metal deck. The front of the building will have storefront entrances adjacent to car parking. The rear of the building will has multiple truck docks and drive in doors.  POC KEVIN GETMAN  kgetman@pickeringfirm.com

Purpose: Existing residence in barn structure to be removed prior to use and of this permit. No shower or tub, no cooking facilities, no sleeping quarters. To construct a new single family residence with 1500 SF of living space, 672 SF garage, and 700 SF of porches and/or decks. Minimum: ’ street/front contextual setback; 15’ side setback(s); and, 20’ rear setback. Shall not exceed three stories. Must conform to all easements on property. Total building coverage on parcel not to exceed 25%. Sidewalks are not required. Individual single and two-family lot tree density standards apply pursuant to M.C.L. 17.24.100, including at least one two-inch caliper tree for each thirty feet of lot frontage (or portion thereof), excluding alley frontage. Signage must be posted pursuant to M.C.L. 16.28.230, including project information signs, which shall be posted in English and Spanish with one double-sided 24  (vertical) × 36  (horizontal) sign posted for every fifty feet of site frontage, with no more than three signs required per street frontage. No construction and/or demolition waste shall be stored on the property all such waste generated by any and all activities governed by this permit shall be disposed of in an approved landfill. Applicant applied for a self-permit and will act as his/her own general contractor with full responsibility for code compliance, for hiring and employing individuals and subcontractors, and with ultimate responsibility for his/her own work and for the work of others. Acting as his/her general contractor, applicant may forfeit certain protections which might be available to him/her through the State of Tennessee general contractor’s licensing process. Applicant, as a self-build permit holder, is further responsible for requesting all required inspections and completing all authorized work in compliance with applicable adopted codes. Separate permits are required for any electrical, plumbing and gas/mechanical work and are not part of the building permit.

Addition:  Site prep  -Install silt fence.  -Protect existing home finishes.  -Demo and remove existing conditions necessary to build.  -Have addition layout and grade established by surveyor (when necessary)  Excavation  -Excavate, grade and prep for concrete footers and Slab.  Concrete  -Install gravel and drainage.  -Install concrete footers with necessary rebar reinforcement.  -Install concrete slab and trowel finish.  Framing  -Frame basement level walls per plan  -Frame 1st floor system per plan  -Frame exterior walls with door and window openings per plan  -Frame roof system with vaulted ceiling per plan.  -Tie in walls and roof system to existing home per plan.  Roofing  -Install synthetic underlayment, drip edge.  -Install (30 year) Architectural shingles per plan.  -Tie into existing roofing (does not include replacing existing roofing unless specified)  -Install standard 6in gutters and downspouts. (Does not include leaf guards)  Exterior Trim  -Install soffit, fascia, and exterior trim per plan.  Siding  -Install Hardie board & batten siding per plan.  Doors  -Provide and install exterior doors per plan. (See selection budget)  Windows  -Provide and install windows per plan. (See selection budget)  HVAC  -Provide and install ductwork to tie into existing system if the system can support the  additional sq ft. (to be evaluated during preconstruction)  Electrical  -Provide and install subpanel and run power from existing service per plans. (Size of  panel and wire determined by power needs)  Insulation  -Insulate exterior walls and roofline with open cell spray foam.  Painting  -Paint exterior, soffit, facia, trim, and doors. (SW Duration paint or comparable)  -Paint exterior siding. (SW Duration paint or comparable)  Clean up  -Clean up of site provided throughout the project including a final clean at the end.  General Conditions  -Jasper Project management and Superintendent time is billed per hour of time spent  managing the project.

Purpose: ***PER HOLLY PERRY NO LONGER DOING THIS WORK WANTS APP CANCELED ---TP EMAIL ATTACHED *****        UCD is proposing to build an addition onto the home at 2217 Lindell Avenue. The addition to the home will be on CMU and have a small crawl space. The crawlspace is to be encapsulated.  There will be two parts to the addition of the home, one in the back of the home and another to the left side of the home. The home will be framed to have 3 bedrooms & 3 baths with four (4) exterior doors and forty-eight (48) windows. New HVAC system will be installed, new electrical will be installed with four (4) exhaust fans and fifty (50) can lights, new plumbing will be installed with a free-standing tub and sauna in the master bath along with three (3) showers and three (3) toilets. The exterior will have a shingle roof, hardie lap siding with a stone veneer wall on the front-left side of the addition. Rockwool insulation will be used for the walls and closed cell in the ceiling and attic. New drywall, trim, cabinets and granite countertops will be installed. Engineered flooring will be installed with hardwood stair treads. Tile flooring will be installed in the wet areas totalling approximately 713 square feet, wall tile to be installed for shower surrounds is approximately 256 square feet along with kitchen tile backsplash, two (2) large glass shower doors and two (2) small glass shower doors. Basic landscaping and a driveway will be installed. Rear setback is 20ft and side setbacks are 5ft unless changed by historical commission.

Subdivision Lot: LOT 21 PT LOT 22 BLK 19, YARBROUGHS SUB WOODLAND
Purpose: I WAS TOLD TO SUBMIT A NEW PERMIT FROM THE OTHER ONE.  UCD is proposing to build an addition onto the home at 2217 Lindell Avenue. The addition to the home will be on CMU and have a small crawl space. The crawlspace is to be encapsulated. There will be two parts to the addition of the home, one in the back of the home and another to the left side of the home. The home will be framed to have 3 bedrooms & 3 baths with four (4) exterior doors and forty-eight (48) windows. New HVAC system will be installed, new electrical will be installed with four (4) exhaust fans and fifty (50) can lights, new plumbing will be installed with a free-standing tub and sauna in the master bath along with three (3) showers and three (3) toilets. The exterior will have a shingle roof, hardie lap siding with a stone veneer wall on the front-left side of the addition. Rockwool insulation will be used for the walls and closed cell in the ceiling and attic. New drywall, trim, cabinets and granite countertops will be installed. Engineered flooring will be installed with hardwood stair treads. Tile flooring will be installed in the wet areas totalling approximately 713 square feet, wall tile to be installed for shower surrounds is approximately 256 square feet along with kitchen tile backsplash, two (2) large glass shower doors and two (2) small glass shower doors. Basic landscaping and a driveway will be installed. Rear setback is 20ft and side setbacks are 5ft unless changed by historical commission.

The existing garage was converted to finished space at some point in the past. The main house experienced fire damage recently, and therefore the power has been disconnected. The detached accessory dwelling was not damaged by the fire. This property is currently being used as a women's group/rehabilitation home. The owners would like to install an independent power supply and meter to this detached accessory dwelling as to provide shelter for the displaced tenants. NES has sent their engineer to evaluate the proposed location and have provided instructions to facilitate the proposed power supply. There is an existing electrical panel in the detached dwelling that was powered by the main house and has been deemed acceptable by NES. The scope of work includes the following: Install meter base on front of the existing detached accessory dwelling structure, wiring to existing panel box inside the detached accessory dwelling, install conduit riser and weatherhead to meet and building & NES requirements.

This permit is one of two. This permit is to create a new dwelling unit on the second level of the existing building creating a duplex. Work per this permit includes: Expand interior walls 6-12 feet towards the back of the parcel and increasing the size of a dormer and turn area into a second unit. This may result in an overhang, but no changes to the footprint of the house. 2-4 windows will be added towards the rear of the home, along with covering the interior stair opening, additional flooring, a kitchen, a bathroom, and two bedroom spaces. Exterior door and stairs will be added, likely above the driveway which would face 1004 Carolyn Ave. 10-15 outlets added, 5-8 overhead lights and ceiling fans in some combination, shower vent, new electric panel and meter will be added. Heat/AC will be via wall unit. Plumber will run pipe for bathroom, kitchen, and washer. No gas will be added to the upstairs. This will add between 180-360 SQFT to the home. Also inlcudes a 7' x 8' deck. Purpose is for LONG TERM renters.

Basically, we will be increasing the size of the existing den, relocating the laundry room, and expanding on the exterior living areas of the home. We will also be giving the front of the home a  face lift  by removing a 2 front door scenario and relocating the front door to the center of the home. The house was once a duplex.  We will be needing to install a temporary culvert from Castleman Drive to the owners front yard, in order to create a parking area for workers and unloading location for material deliveries. There is currently a ditch in front of the home, so we plan to just lay the culvert in place, cover it with gravel, and use it without cutting into the existing grade of the ditch.  The culvert will be comparable in size to the ones on either side of it, that are under the driveways of either side of the subject property.

We will be adding on the rear of the home to increase the size of the existing living room. We will also be adding a new covered screen porch and new deck on the rear of the home. There will be renovations to the exterior of the front elevation of the home as well. We will basically, be giving the front a  face lift  with removing both front doors (this house used to be a duplex) and raising the roof line when we relocate the front door to its new location. We will need to install a culvert for the renovation that will allow subcontractors to park in the front yard instead of the street. The ditch is already there, so we will be putting the temporary culvert in the existing ditch and covering it with gravel. We plan on matching the culvert size to the ones on either side of subject property, so the storm water flow should not be interrupted.

The purpose of the Wagster Mst Closet Addition Project is to construct a 121 sq. ft. mst closet addition in the location of an existing deck. The existing deck will be removed. A new concrete foundation will be poured, 24”x12”, connecting the existing footings. An 8” block foundation wall with brick veneer will be laid to match existing foundation. Floor joist will be 2x10 with ¾” subfloor. Walls will be constructed of 2x4 with ½” O.S.B. sheathing and house wrap. Ceiling joists will be 2x8 – 16” O.C. Rafters will be 2x8 - 16” O.C., with ½” OSB sheathing and 30 yr. Dim shingles. Walls will be insulated with R-13 batt insulation, ceiling with R-33 batt insulation and floor with R-19 batt insulation. Interior of structure will be finished with ½” drywall and painted. Project will take approximately 8 weeks to complete at an estimated cost of $38,645.00.

To construct a 2-story single family dwelling with 1,675 SF of living area, 17 SF of porch area, and 481 SF of garage area per plan RM20 zoning. 20' front setback, 5’ min side setback, and 20’ min rear setback. Not to be over any easements. Individual single and two-family lot tree density standards apply pursuant to M.C.L. 17.24.100, including at least one two-inch caliper tree for each thirty feet of lot frontage (or portion thereof), excluding alley frontage in regard to metro council bill 2017-835. Signage must be posted pursuant to M.C.L. 16.28.230, including project information signs, which shall be posted in English and Spanish with one double-sided 24 h × 36 w sign posted for every fifty feet of site frontage, with no more than three signs required per street frontage. The holder of this permit hereby certifies that all construction and demolition waste generated by any and all activities governed by this permit shall be disposed of in an approved landfill. The holder of this permit also certifies that no construction or demolition waste shall be stored on the property in violation of any provisions of the metropolitan code.

New single family home of 5,894sqft conditioned space. Three car garage of 824sqft, porches of 756sqft. Total of 7,454sqft under roof.     Two stories with daylight basement.    Mr. Smith:    We did find that this property does meet the conditions for two single-family homes. We can resolve that issue when you re-apply. However, we do see that you haven’t files for an HPR yet.    Parcels must be mapped for an HPR through the Mapping division of the Planning department before applying for a building permit.  An attorney needs to draw up the HPR deeds for unit A, unit B and common area.  Then it will need to be will recorded with the Registrar of Deeds office.  The recorded deed will be taken to the Property Mapping Division of the Planning Department for mapping purposes. Once the mapping has taken place permits can be applied for with Metro Codes.         Feel free to send us any additional or follow up questions.    ZONING HELPDESK – Chuck Cardona   EMAIL: zoninghelpdesk@nashville.gov  PHONE:  615-880-2359

We will be adding a 12' wide, 8' deep covered structure over the existing deck. The covering will not tie into the house for structural support, it will be freestanding with (4) 6 x6  posts in in-ground footings coming through the existing deck. The beams will be 4 x6  beams on all 4 sides. They will meet mitered on top of the notched 6x6 posts with 12  structural screws going straight down from the top of the beam into the posts on each side of the beams. There will also be 4  structural screws going from the notched piece of the posts laterally into the beams. The rafters will be 2 x6  and spaced 12  OC with a (2) 2 x8  ridge beam. The rafters will be tied to the beams with hurricane ties and rafter hangers on the ridge beam. The ridge beam will be supported by a 4 x4  post with metal connectors to the beam and ridge beam. The covering roof will match the existing house roof and the ceilings will be vaulted. There will be flashing from under the house siding out onto the roof of the covered structure.

Once specified and approved, Jasper will be responsible to source, purchase and deliver to the project in time for construction. Our markup will be applied to these selections at billing. • What is cost-plus : The cost-plus structure is the direct cost of the subcontractors’ invoices, building materials, selection invoices, and Jasper direct project labor cost, Plus our overhead and profit markup. This includes work related to the punch lists which is part of completing the project. • What is included : The budget totals in this proposal include all estimated construction cost, Jasper’s labor cost for managing the project, and our 25% markup. • How this proposal is structured : We divide this proposal into distinct sections and phases corresponding to various areas of your home. 3 Scope does not include $7,000 for drywall and paint of first floor.
